definition: to attend a lecture/to listen to a talk
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

sentences.english: However, in my dream, Jabes had a full and attentive congregation ;
sentences.chinese: 但是，在我的夢裏，傑別斯有專心聽講的滿會堂會衆。

sentences.english: Xiaohua performance is the best students, he loves learning and concentrate on the lectures.
sentences.chinese: 小華是成績最好學生，他熱愛學習，專心聽講。

sentences.english: Today is your last lesson in French. I beg you to pay attention.
sentences.chinese: 今天是你們最後一次法語課，我懇求你們用心聽講。

sentences.english: After every lectured, each student needs to write their report about the lecture.
sentences.chinese: 課程中安排數場演講，同學聽講後撰寫心得報告。

sentences.english: At the English class in Power, I'm active to speak and study hard.
sentences.chinese: 在博爾英語課上，我很積極舉手發言，上課認真聽講。

sentences.english: Millie listens as carefully as Lucy does.
sentences.chinese: 米麗和露西聽講一樣認真。

sentences.english: Class attendance seriously, and actively raised their hands to speak, learning strong drilling.
sentences.chinese: 上課認真聽講，積極舉手發言，學習有鑽勁。

sentences.english: The teacher jumped on the inattentive pupil in class.
sentences.chinese: 老師責備那個在課堂上不注意聽講的學生。

sentences.english: Certificates of Attendance will not be re-issued.
sentences.chinese: 所有聽講證書將不予補發。
